content.text: After joining ESAP, Shen Muchuan started reading the profiles of the other members.
1549, in orbit. 1738, human, Mediator. 2275, human, Healer. And 1547.
She spent a long time on 1547's profile.

There really was a lot there, but volume was not why it took her an entire afternoon. After finishing, she was left with a feeling that was hard to name. Not fear. Not admiration. Not aversion. Just... distance.
Her experience, her emotions, even her very existence carried a powerful density. Like a painting with saturation pushed to the limit: every pixel straining, every detail trying to say something.
Shen Muchuan was not used to that kind of density. She was the kind of person who left a lot of blank space. In her work, the most important part was often the empty part.
In the group chat, her interactions with 1547 were normal: replying to work messages, confirming design requirements, occasionally sending "ok" or "received." Online communication was fine.
But when it came to meeting offline, she kept avoiding it.
47 said she wants to meet and talk about design.
1548 did not press. That was one of the reasons Shen Muchuan liked her: she never pressed.
One evening in April, Shen Muchuan drew a picture on her tablet.
There were two people in the image. One close, with a sharp outline. One far away, only a blurred silhouette. A large stretch of blank space between them.
She looked at it for a while, saved it to her private folder, and sent it to no one.
